snippet: Justice Thomas D. Raffaele said that a police officer, who was kneeing a handcuffed man in the back, suddenly turned on him.
abstract: New York City Police Dept's Internal Affairs Bureau and the Civilian Complaint Review Board are investigating a complaint from New York State Supreme Court Justice Thomas D Raffaele that he was assaulted by a police officer at the scene of an arrest in Queens; Raffaele claims he was drawn to the chaos in an effort to help police control an increasingly unruly crowd and was instead struck by an enraged officer who hit him hard enough to send him to the hospital.
lead_paragraph: Justice Thomas D. Raffaele said that a police officer, who was kneeing a handcuffed man in the back, suddenly turned on him.

headline.seo: Justice Thomas D. Raffaele Says Police Officer Struck Him
headline.main: Judge Says He Was Struck by a Police Officer in Queens
headline.print_headline: Judge Says He Was Struck by a Police Officer in Queens
